title.narrative: 8.1.4 SBC: EFFECTIVE SOCIAL & BEHAVIOR CHANGE

description.narrative: By 2025, programmes, partners and civil society have tools, guidance, and resources to implement individual and social change and strengthen community participation for the realization of children's rights., which contributes to Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change, Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Innovation, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2025, the programme of cooperation is designed, coordinated, managed and supported effectively to generate the expected results for children in accordance with quality norms and standards.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

description.narrative: The CO focused mainly on COVID-19 prevention and vaccination and Ebola prevention through mass communication campaigns and capacity building of government partners and civil society actors, including community-based organizations and existing platforms of religious leaders, community radios and U-Reporters, as well as by tracking COVID-related misinformation. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:28/01/2022
